body: @blizzz

actually, i never experienced this issue with ldap backend. 

can you please provide steps how to reproduce? authentication backends should be loaded when necessary. otherwise it is a regression compared to 4.5...

user_ldap doesn't appear to use the "user_backends" configuration option... in fact, user_external appears to be the only "shipped" authentication app that doesn't call oc_user::userbackend() on class load -- it defers it until called from oc_user::setupbackends() -- this appears to be because user_external has 3 implementations, and doesn't want to register them all.

user_ldap, user_webdavauth and user_openid all call userbackend() on load (when enabled), and so none of them would be impacted when setupbackends isn't correctly called after the class is loaded.  not sure if there's any documentation on this for authentication app writers, but there definitely appears to be a bug in the general handling of authentication classes related to different entry points (some of which require authentication, and don't include it in $runtime_apptypes (or set $runtime_noapps!)

probably the correct fix is to:
a) audit/fix all entry points to correctly load authentication apps if they need it
b) allow setupbackends() to not fail if a user_backend class is missing (since it may not be needed on, say, a public page).
the setupbackends() method actually is used only for backends that are configured in config.php. cc @icewind1991
it's actually *flooding* my logs with "user backend oc_user_imap not found" when i connect with a caldav client.

@clemenssahs user_external works a bit different than other user backends, iirc it's triggered by setupbackends().
@blizzz hmm... glad it's safe to remove. thanks for letting me know. :)
